群.definition: group; crowd; flock, herd, pack etc

群嘲.definition: (neologism c. 2011) to deride a group of people; (of a group of people) to deride (sb)

群居.definition: to live together (in a large group or flock)

群峰.definition: the peaks of a mountain range

群演.definition: extra (actor engaged to appear in a crowd scene) (abbr. for 群眾演員|群众演员[qun2zhong4 yan3yuan2])

群發.definition: to send to multiple recipients; mass mailout; to occur in a clustered fashion

群眾外包.definition: crowdsourcing; abbr. to 眾包|众包[zhong4 bao1]

群眾性.definition: to do with the masses; mass (meeting, movement etc)

群眾演員.definition: extra (actor engaged to appear in a crowd scene)

群眾路線.definition: the mass line, CCP term for Party policy aimed at broadening and cultivating contacts with the masses

群租.definition: to rent to multiple co-tenants, esp. where the number of tenants exceeds what the dwelling is fit to accommodate (i.e. involving subdivision of rooms etc)

群聊.definition: (computing) group chat; to have a group chat

群聚.definition: to gather; to congregate; to aggregate

群芳.definition: all flowers; all beauties; all talents

群英.definition: assemblage of talented individuals; ensemble of heroes

群英會.definition: distinguished gathering; a meeting of heroes

群言堂.definition: letting everyone have their say; taking people's views into account; free expression of different views; (contrasted with 一言堂[yi1 yan2 tang2])

群起而攻之.definition: the masses rise to attack it (idiom); Everyone is against the idea.; universally abhorrent

群雄.definition: outstanding heroes; warlords vying for supremacy (in former times); stars (of sports or pop music)

群雄逐鹿.definition: great heroes pursue deer in the central plains (idiom); fig. many vie for supremacy

群集.definition: to gather; to congregate; to aggregate

群飛.definition: to fly as a flock or swarm

群體性事件.definition: mass incident (PRC term for incidents of social unrest, including rioting, melees and petition campaigns)

群龍無首.definition: lit. a thunder of dragons without a head; fig. a group lacking a leader
